item.title: MA add a quote by Bessie Anderson Stanley
MA add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: MA add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: MA add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: MA add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "The very least you can do in your life is figure out what you hope for. And the most you can do is live inside that hope. Not admire it from a distance but live right in it, under its roof." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: MA add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Close the door. Write with no one looking over your shoulder. Don't try to figure out what other people want to hear from you; figure out what you have to say. It's the one and only thing you have to offer." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: MA add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "It's what you do that makes your soul." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: MA add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Memory is a complicated thing, a relative to truth, but not its twin." -- Barbara Kingsolver
